thread.title: Trump's voter fraud investigation may want to start with his own daughter
thread.title_full: Trump's voter fraud investigation may want to start with his own daughter

author: Sasha Lekach
title: Trump's voter fraud investigation may want to start with his own daughter

persons.name: steve bannon steven mnuchin tiffany trump

text:
Donald Trump brought out the ALL CAPS Wednesday to show just how seriously he's taking his unsubstantiated claims of voter fraud in the election that he won.
"I will be asking for a major investigation into VOTER FRAUD," he wrote over two tweets, "including those registered to vote in two states, those who are illegal and even those registered to vote who are dead (and many for a long time). Depending on results, we will strengthen up voting procedures."
But there's a glaring problem with his proclaimed crackdown â€” his own daughter falls under one of the examples he lists of bad voting behavior: people registered to vote in two states.
SEE ALSO: Donald Trump is lying about illegal votes being cast in the election
Tiffany Trump, who voted in New York City in November's election, is also registered in Pennsylvania where she went to college at the University of Pennsylvania, as HeatStreet reported and other outlets confirmed.
Also outed as two-state registrants Wednesday: White House senior advisor Steve Bannon and Trump cabinet nominee Steve Mnuchin.
Trump's daughter Tiffany is double registered.
Image: AP Photo/Seth Wenig
In a Sarasota, Florida, Herald-Tribune column , Bannon was discovered to be registered at his Florida home and a New York City home. He voted absentee in New York in the 2016 presidential election, according to the paper.
Sarasota County supervisor of elections says that Bannon was removed today from county voting rolls because he's also registered in NYC.
â€” Christopher Massie (@chrismassie) January 25, 2017
Trump's Treasury Secretary cabinet pick Mnuchin is also a twofer; he's registered to vote in California and New York, as reported by CNN .
Trump cabinet nominee Steven Mnuchin is also registered to vote in two states https://t.co/Av45x8F8q6
â€” andrew kaczynski ðŸ¤” (@KFILE) January 25, 2017
Being registered in two states isn't voter fraud. The fraud only happens if that person votes in both places in the same election.
On social media, users were quick to point out the irony of Trump's own family and staff being involved in the very problem he devoted two whole tweets to.
Hey, Donald Trump, think we've found your massive VOTER FRAUD. Double voters outed so far today:
Steve Bannon
Steven Mnuchin
Tiffany Trump https://t.co/VnFIYr0Zpd
â€” Yael T. Abouhalkah (@YaelTAbouhalkah) January 25, 2017
Waiting to hear that Trump was registered to vote in all 50 states+Territories
"Steven Mnuchin" #voterfraud #steve Bannon #tiffanytrump
â€” Daniel Bitcoin (@BTC110) January 25, 2017
Tiffany Trump AND Steve Bannon registered to vote in two states. @realDonaldTrump Looks like your voter clean-up can start at home! https://t.co/Oa1FiwmF2N
â€” Michelle Duffy (@wandermom) January 25, 2017
More awkwardness: Tiffany Trump, Steve Bannon (advisor), and Steve Mnuchin (Treasury nominee), are all registered to vote in 2 states #Oops pic.twitter.com/mLEebD3Jfv
â€” Andrew Seidel (@AndrewLSeidel) January 25, 2017
Looks like it's time for Trump to strengthen up voting procedures right at home and at the office.
BONUS: Yes, Trump watched the Women's Marches, and yes, he tweeted about it
